text: greetings my name is Matt wood and I'm
here at aw headquarters in Seattle to
give you an update on the AWS key
management service AWS kms makes it easy
for you to create and control the
encryption keys used to encrypt your
data it's integrated with several other
AWS services such as s3 EBS RDS and
redshift is also integrated with cloud
trail to provide you with logs of all
key usage many customers have asked for
a simple way to maintain the local
control of their encryption keys will
also be able to take advantage of the
automation integration and cost
structure of kms so today we're adding a
new feature to kms that will let you
import your keys from your existing key
management infrastructure into kms and
use those imported keys with kms
integrated services or your own custom
applications this new feature will give
you greater control over the generation
lifecycle management and durability of
your keys as well as help you meet
compliance requirements to generate and
store copies of keys outside of AWS you
can learn more about this new feature by
visiting our website that's it thanks a
lot
